Platform.Title: [HuEx-1_0-st] Affymetrix Human Exon 1.0 ST Array [probe set (exon) version]
Platform.Description:
Affymetrix submissions are typically submitted to GEO using the GEOarchive method described at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/geo/info/geo_affy.html
#%create_date=Wed Mar 11 17:51:22 2009 PDT #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-v2 #%lib_set_name=HuEx-1_0-st #%lib_set_version=v2 #%genome-species=Homo sapiens #%genome-version=hg18 #%genome-version-ucsc=hg18 #%genome-version-ncbi=36 #%genome-version-create_date=2006-03 #%netaffx-annotation-date=2009-03-16 #%netaffx-annotation-netaffx-build=28

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: probeset_id

Column.Name: GB_LIST
Column.Description: GenBank and RefSeq Accessions from mrna_assignment column

Column.Name: SPOT_ID
Column.Description: genomic location of the transcript cluster in the version of the genome assembly used at annotation time. Coordinates are standard 1-based (length=stop-start+1).

Column.Name: seqname
Column.Description: chromosome

Column.Name: RANGE_GB
Column.Description: NCBI RefSeq for chromosome of current build

Column.Name: RANGE_STRAND
Column.Description: strand (+|-)

Column.Name: RANGE_START
Column.Description: start (integer). Coordinates are standard 1-based (length=stop-start+1).

Column.Name: RANGE_STOP
Column.Description: stop (integer). Coordinates are standard 1-based (length=stop-start+1).

Column.Name: probe_count
Column.Description: Total number of probes in this probe set

Column.Name: transcript_cluster_id
Column.Description: Unique identifier for the transcript cluster containing this probe set.

Column.Name: exon_id
Column.Description: Unique identifier for the exon cluster containing this probe set.

Column.Name: psr_id
Column.Description: Unique identifier for the probe selection region containing this probe set.

Column.Name: gene_assignment
Column.Description: Gene name(s) for each assigned mRNA for mRNAs that corresponds to known genes.

Column.Name: mrna_assignment
Column.Description: Public mRNAs that should be detected by this probe set based on sequence alignment determined at the time of the current NetAffx annotation update.

Column.Name: level
Column.Description: Level of design-time annotation support for the probe set.

Column.Name: probeset_type
Column.Description: Array design category of the probe set.

Sample.Title: Exon arrays of Roadmap cell types; flow sorted CD34+ cells from cord blood; DS12339-exon

Channel.Source: flow sorted CD34+ cells from cord blood; DS12339-exon
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Followed vendor recommendations for growth protocol/media
Channel.Extract-Protocol: At cell harvest, a subset of cells was stored at -20 C in RNALater. Total RNA from 5 X 10^6 cells were purified using Ribopure (Ambion) according to vendor recommended protocols. Total RNA quality was assessed on RNA 6000 Nano Chips (Agilent) using a Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.2587 sample alias: RO 01536 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.2397
Sample.Data-Processing: Intensity files from the scanned exon arrays were analyzed at the exon level (Affymetrix ExACT 1.2.1 software). Sample data were quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Channel.Characteristics: University of Washington, Congenital Defects Lab. Ian Glass
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: Single read - Illumina

Sample.Description: Design description: Chromatin accessibility determination via DNase-seq Library name: DS14803 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.3116 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.3113 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************
Sample.Data-Processing:
**********************************************************************
ANALYSIS FILE NAME: GSM595926_fBrain-DS14803.hg19.bam ANALYSIS ALIAS: DS14803-align ANALYSIS TITLE: Alignments DS14803 ANALYSIS DESCRIPTION: Bowtie (v0.12.5) alignments of Chromatin Accessibility Illumina sequencing lane data to the human genome The Genome Reference Consortium GRCh37 (hg19) ANALYSIS TYPE: REFERENCE_ALIGNMENT EDACC Genboree Analysis Page: DATA_ANALYSIS_LEVEL: 1 EXPERIMENT_TYPE: Chromatin Accessibility SOFTWARE: Bowtie SOFTWARE_VERSION: 0.12.5 MAXIMUM_ALIGNMENT_LENGTH: 36 MISMATCHES_ALLOWED: 2 ALIGNMENTS_ALLOWED: 1 TREATMENT_OF_MULTIPLE_ALIGNMENTS: not submitted TREATMENT_OF_IDENTICAL_ALIGNMENTS_OF_MULTIPLE_READS: allowed ALIGNMENT_POSTPROCESSING: none
**********************************************************************
ANALYSIS FILE NAME: GSM595926_fBrain-DS14803.75.20.filtered-density.36.hg19.wig ANALYSIS ALIAS: DS14803-signal ANALYSIS TITLE: Signal DS14803 ANALYSIS DESCRIPTION: Chromatin Accessibility data with a sliding window (+/-75bp) summation at 20 bp steps across the genome ANALYSIS TYPE: ABUNDANCE_MEASUREMENT EDACC Genboree Analysis Page: DATA_ANALYSIS_LEVEL: 2 EXPERIMENT_TYPE: Chromatin Accessibility SOFTWARE: signalmap SOFTWARE_VERSION: 1.0 READ_EXTENSION: 150 GENOMIC_WINDOW: 20bp TREATMENT_OF_REGIONS_PRONE_TO_MULTIPLE_ALIGNMENTS: NA
**********************************************************************
ANALYSIS FILE NAME: GSM595926_UW.Fetal_Brain.ChromatinAccessibility.H-23284.DS14803.bed ANALYSIS ALIAS: DS14803.hg19.level.1 ANALYSIS TITLE: Mapping of Fetal Brain Chromatin Accessibility Data ANALYSIS DESCRIPTION: Illumina reads produced by DNAse-Seq on Fetal Brain, Donor H-23284, Library DS14803 were mapped to the human genome using Pash. ANALYSIS TYPE: REFERENCE_ALIGNMENT EDACC Genboree Analysis Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FEDACC%2FANALYSIS%2FEDACC.4133 DATA_ANALYSIS_LEVEL: 1 EXPERIMENT_TYPE: Chromatin Accessibility GENOME_ASSEMBLY: NCBI Build GRCh37/UCSC Build hg19 SOFTWARE: Pash SOFTWARE_VERSION: 3.0 MAXIMUM_ALIGNMENT_LENGTH: Read length MISMATCHES_ALLOWED: 10% of read length ALIGNMENTS_ALLOWED: 1 TREATMENT_OF_MULTIPLE_ALIGNMENTS: If a read maps to more than 1 position it is removed from consideration. TREATMENT_OF_IDENTICAL_ALIGNMENTS_OF_MULTIPLE_READS: None ALIGNMENT_POSTPROCESSING: None RELEASE_NUMBER: Human Epigenome Atlas 2
QUALITY SCORES: NUMBER_OF_CHROMATIN_ACCESSIBILITY_EXPERIMENTS_SCORED: 40 FINDPEAKS_SCORE: 0.5883 FINDPEAKS_PERCENTILE: 60 HOTSPOT_SCORE: 0.5007 HOTSPOT_PERCENTILE: 65 IROC_SCORE: 0.9982 IROC_PERCENTILE: 85 POISSON_SCORE: 0.5231 POISSON_PERCENTILE: 57
**********************************************************************
ANALYSIS FILE NAME: GSM595926_UW.Fetal_Brain.ChromatinAccessibility.H-23284.DS14803.wig ANALYSIS ALIAS: DS14803.hg19.level.2 ANALYSIS TITLE: Raw Signal Density Graphs of Fetal Brain Chromatin Accessibility Data ANALYSIS DESCRIPTION: Illumina DNAse-Seq read mappings from Fetal Brain, Donor H-23284, Library DS14803 were processed into density graphs of raw signal representing the aligned read density. ANALYSIS TYPE: ABUNDANCE_MEASUREMENT EDACC Genboree Analysis Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FEDACC%2FANALYSIS%2FEDACC.4093 DATA_ANALYSIS_LEVEL: 2 EXPERIMENT_TYPE: Chromatin Accessibility GENOME_ASSEMBLY: NCBI Build GRCh37/UCSC Build hg19 SOFTWARE: In house programs and scripts SOFTWARE_VERSION: NA READ_EXTENSION: 0bp GENOMIC_WINDOW: 150bp TREATMENT_OF_REGIONS_PRONE_TO_MULTIPLE_ALIGNMENTS: None RELEASE_NUMBER: Human Epigenome Atlas 2 BROWSER_TRACK_NAME: FB DNase 84 03 BROWSER_TRACK_DESCRIPTION: UW Fetal Brain DNase Hypersensitivity Donor H-23284 Library DS14803 EA Release 2
QUALITY SCORES: NUMBER_OF_CHROMATIN_ACCESSIBILITY_EXPERIMENTS_SCORED: 40 FINDPEAKS_SCORE: 0.5883 FINDPEAKS_PERCENTILE: 60 HOTSPOT_SCORE: 0.5007 HOTSPOT_PERCENTILE: 65 IROC_SCORE: 0.9982 IROC_PERCENTILE: 85 POISSON_SCORE: 0.5231 POISSON_PERCENTILE: 57

Sample.Title: Exon arrays of Roadmap cell types; Fetal Adrenal Gland primary tissue, day 96; DS12528-exon

Channel.Source: Fetal Adrenal Gland primary tissue, day 96; DS12528-exon
Channel.Characteristics: University of Washington, Congenital Defects Lab. Ian Glass
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Followed vendor recommendations for growth protocol/media
Channel.Extract-Protocol: At cell harvest, a subset of cells was stored at -20 C in RNALater. Total RNA from 5 X 10^6 cells were purified using Ribopure (Ambion) according to vendor recommended protocols. Total RNA quality was assessed on RNA 6000 Nano Chips (Agilent) using a Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.3497 sample alias: fAdrenal.H-22662d96 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.2443
Sample.Data-Processing: Intensity files from the scanned exon arrays were analyzed at the exon level (Affymetrix ExACT 1.2.1 software). Sample data were quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Channel.Extract-Protocol: At cell harvest, a subset of cells was stored at -20 C in RNALater. Total RNA from 5 X 10^6 cells were purified using Ribopure (Ambion) according to vendor recommended protocols. Total RNA quality was assessed on RNA 6000 Nano Chips (Agilent) using a Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.3496 sample alias: fBrain.H-22911d117 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.3143
Sample.Data-Processing: Intensity files from the scanned exon arrays were analyzed at the exon level (Affymetrix ExACT 1.2.1 software). Sample data were quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER summarized

Sample.Title: Exon arrays of Roadmap cell types; flow sorted CD34+ cells from cord blood; DS11202-exon

Channel.Source: flow sorted CD34+ cells from cord blood; DS11202-exon
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Followed vendor recommendations for growth protocol/media
Channel.Extract-Protocol: At cell harvest, a subset of cells was stored at -20 C in RNALater. Total RNA from 5 X 10^6 cells were purified using Ribopure (Ambion) according to vendor recommended protocols. Total RNA quality was assessed on RNA 6000 Nano Chips (Agilent) using a Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.7376 sample alias: RO 01508 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.1645
Sample.Data-Processing: Intensity files from the scanned exon arrays were analyzed at the exon level (Affymetrix ExACT 1.2.1 software). Sample data were quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Sample.Title: Exon arrays of Roadmap cell types; flow sorted CD34+ cells from cord blood; DS14200-exon

Channel.Source: flow sorted CD34+ cells from cord blood; DS14200-exon
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Followed vendor recommendations for growth protocol/media
Channel.Extract-Protocol: At cell harvest, a subset of cells was stored at -20 C in RNALater. Total RNA from 5 X 10^6 cells were purified using Ribopure (Ambion) according to vendor recommended protocols. Total RNA quality was assessed on RNA 6000 Nano Chips (Agilent) using a Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.7549 sample alias: RO 01549 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.2401
Sample.Data-Processing: Intensity files from the scanned exon arrays were analyzed at the exon level (Affymetrix ExACT 1.2.1 software). Sample data were quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Sample.Title: Exon arrays of Roadmap cell types; flow sorted CD3+ Primary Cells, Mobilized, year 36; DS11148-exon

Channel.Source: flow sorted CD3+ Primary Cells, Mobilized, year 36; DS11148-exon
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Followed vendor recommendations for growth protocol/media
Channel.Extract-Protocol: At cell harvest, a subset of cells was stored at -20 C in RNALater. Total RNA from 5 X 10^6 cells were purified using Ribopure (Ambion) according to vendor recommended protocols. Total RNA quality was assessed on RNA 6000 Nano Chips (Agilent) using a Bioanalyzer (Agilent).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.12960 sample alias: CD3.RO_01508 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.8318
Sample.Data-Processing: Intensity files from the scanned exon arrays were analyzed at the exon level (Affymetrix ExACT 1.2.1 software). Sample data were quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: quantile normalized with PM-GCBG background correction and PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Intensity Error) summarized

Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: A Whole Transcript Sense Target Labeling Assay (Affymetrix) was used to reduce the rRNA, perform in vitro transcription (IVT) and create labeled sense strand DNA for hybridization to the arrays.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridizations were carried out according the manufacturer (Affymetrix) protocol
Sample.Description: Exon profiling of NREMC cell types, these coincide with chromatin accessibility sequencing assays. Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: Single read - Illumina

Sample.Description: Design description: Digital Genomic Footprinting determination via DNase-seq Library name: DGF.DS18406 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.14170 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.2872 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************
Sample.Data-Processing:
**********************************************************************

Sample.Title: Chromatin accessibility assay of Heart; DNase.DS20383

Channel.Source: Adult Heart primary tissue, year 3; DNase.DS20383
Channel.Characteristics: After the donor aorta and inferior mesenteric vein (IMV) were cannulated, the aorta was flushed with 5L of 4degC cooled histidine-tryptophan-ketoglutarate solution (HTK) and the IMV was flushed with 3L of HTK which results in the perfusion of all intra-abdominal organs with preservative solution. The abdominal cavity was cooled topically with ice during perfusion. The relevant tissues were then removed and transported to a local laboratory within 1 hour. There, the tissues were minced with a blade and 1gm of tissue was placed into a cryovial with 1mL of freezing solution (freezing solution 50mL: 25mL DMEM, 10mL Normosol-R, 10mL 25% BSA, 5mL DMSO, 1 tablet protease inhibitor) for 15min on ice. The cyrovial was then placed in a 1inch-thick styrofoam container, and then placed into -80C freezer, resulting in a slow freezing to -80C over an 1hour period.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: Single read - Illumina

Sample.Description: Design description: Chromatin accessibility determination via DNase-seq Library name: DNase.DS20383 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.14534 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUniversity%20of%20Washington%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.14533 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Series.Title: University of Washington Human Reference Epigenome Mapping Project
Series.Summary:
The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium aims to produce a public resource of epigenomic maps for stem cells and primary ex vivo tissues selected to represent the normal counterparts of tissues and organ systems frequently involved in human disease.
Study of chromatin accessibility and expression using exon arrays.
**************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************
